pycantus.filtration package

Submodules

pycantus.filtration.filter module

This module defines the base class for filters used in the PyCantus library. It provides a structure for creating and applying filters to chant data.

class pycantus.filtration.filter.Filter(name: str)

Bases: object

Base class for filters over Corpus data lists:

  • chants - objects of class pycantus.models.Chant

  • sources - objects of class pycantus.models.Source

name

Name of the filter, used in export.

Type:

str

filters_include

{ Data fields : Values to be included after filtration }

Type:

defaultdict(list)

filters_exclude

{ Data fields : Values to be excluded after filtration }

Type:

defaultdict(list)

add_value_exclude(field: str, values: list[str] | list[int] | int | str)

Add a value of specific field to the filter to be excluded.

Other non-specified values would be kept during filtration.

Parameters:

  • field (str) – Data field (Chant or Source attribute).

  • values – Either single value (str or int) or list of values to be included after filtration.

add_value_include(field: str, values: list[str] | list[int] | int | str)

Add a value of specific field to the filter to be included. Other non-specified values would be dropped during filtration.

Parameters:

  • field (str) – Data field (Chant or Source attribute).

  • values – Either single value (str or int) or list of values to be included after filtration.

apply(chants: list, sources: list) → tuple[list]

Apply the filter to the given data. If no values for field are specified we expect that user does not care about the field. If no filter is to be applied, returns the original lists. Method should not be called directly, but through Corpus.apply_filter() method.

Parameters:

  • chants (list) – List of chants from the Corpus to be filtered.

  • source (list) – List of sources from the Corpus to be filtered.

Returns:

Reduced list of chants after filtration. list: Reduced list of sources after filtration.

Return type:

list

as_yaml() → str
Returns

str: yaml style string representation of filter configuration.

delete_field(field)

Deletes a field from both the include and the exclude filters.

export_yaml(path: str)

Export the filter configuration to a directory given as path as ‘{self.name}.yaml’ YAML file.

Tries to create the directory if it does not exist.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to directory where export YAML file should be created.

import_string(yaml_string: str)

Function that reads YAML style string and transforms it into self.filter_include and self.filter_exclude dictionaries (= working filter)

Parameters:

yaml_string (str) – YAML style string to be loaded into filter configuration.

import_yaml(config_file_path: str)

Function that reads YAML file and transforms it into self.filter_include and self.filter_exclude dictionaries.

Parameters:

config_file_path (str) – Path to YAML to be loaded into filter configuration.
